properties.areaDesc: Jackson; Douglas; Osage; Shawnee; Franklin; Wabaunsee; Lyon; Jefferson; Morris; Anderson; Coffey
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 3:15PM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Night through
Saturday...

A strong storm system will approach the region late tonight into
Friday with rainfall overspreading much of northeast and east
central Kansas. Temperatures will rapidly fall during the evening
hours Friday, transitioning precipition to a wintry mix of
freezing rain and sleet. All precipitation is expected to
transition to snow by sunrise Saturday morning, with periods of
light to moderate snow continuing through Saturday afternoon.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow
accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to
two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35
mph.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas.

* WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
